---
title: "Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita"
---

A quick look at how life expectancy changes with GDP per capita.

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px

df = px.data.gapminder().copy()
x = np.log10(df['gdpPercap'])
y = df['lifeExp']

coef = np.polyfit(x, y, 1)
fit = np.poly1d(coef)

plt.figure(figsize=(7,5))
plt.scatter(df['gdpPercap'], df['lifeExp'], alpha=0.4, s=18, c="#87CEFA")
x_sorted = np.linspace(df['gdpPercap'].min(), df['gdpPercap'].max(), 400)
plt.plot(x_sorted, fit(np.log10(x_sorted)), linewidth=2.0, c="#6A0DAD")
plt.xscale('log')
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita (log scale)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (years)")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

print("slope_years_per_log10GDP =", round(coef[0], 2))
print("intercept =", round(coef[1], 2))
